abstract.text: Instantiates a new workout that includes the energy burned, distance, and metadata for the workout.

inlineContent.text: Use HKWorkoutBuilder

inlineContent.text: The type of activity performed during the workout. For a complete list of activity types, see
The date and time when the activity started.
The date and time when the activity ended. This date must be equal to or later than the start date.
A time interval representing the workout’s actual duration. Passing a nonzero value sets the workout’s
property. If you pass 0, this method calculates the
property based on the workout’s start and end dates.

objects. For a complete list of predefined metadata keys, see Metadata Keys.
Using predefined keys helps facilitate sharing data between apps; however, you are also encouraged to create your own, custom keys as needed to extend the workout’s capabilities.
A workout object with the provided duration, total energy burned, total distance, and metadata properties. The

This method returns a workout with the specified duration, total energy burned, total distance and metadata. The
property and the device are set to

If the total energy burned or total distance are nonzero values, create a set of corresponding samples that add up to the calculated totals. Associate these samples with the workout by calling the health store’s
method.

code: totalEnergyBurned: energyBurned, totalDistance: distance, metadata: metadata)

abstract.text: A representation of a specific point in time, for use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
An object wrapper for primitive scalar numeric values.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
Associates the provided samples with the specified workout.
The metadata for this HealthKit object.
An object that stores a value for a given unit.
A workout sample that stores information about a single physical activity.
The workout’s duration.
Instantiates a new workout.
Instantiates a new workout activity that includes the device that produced the sample data.
Instantiates a new workout that includes the energy burned, distance, and metadata for the workout.
Instantiates a workout that includes both workout events and the device that produced the sample data.
Instantiates a new workout whose duration is calculated based on the start and end dates and the provided workout events.
Instantiates a workout using a variety of data, including the number of flights of stairs climbed.
Instantiates a workout using a variety of data, including the number of strokes while swimming.
The total distance traveled during the workout.
The total active energy burned during the workout.
The type of activity performed during the workout.
An array of workout event objects.
The type of activity performed during a workout.
A number of seconds.
A representation of a specific point in time, for use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
